$$NOTE1.text:
Subject: Emailing: EShell
From:    "EXI-Vasilenko, Alexander I" <Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com>
Date:    Wed, 10 Feb 2010 03:35:33 -0800
To:      <sbgolob@cbttape.org>

Hi, Sam!

It has turned out that I have been compelled to expand ISPF
Command Shell panel.  I did it successfully and now I have 20
commands in stack.  It is enough at this time.

May be this possibility will useful for you.

In attachment:

ISRTSOA  - ISPF Command Shell panel in XMIT format. It must be
          copied in any customer ISPPLIB library.
DOESHL   - REXX procedure, which fulfils additional command stack
          function. Copy it to customer SYSPROC.
DOECMP   - REXX procedure, which supports compress function for
          expanded stack. Copy it to customer SYSPROC.

With best wishes,
Alexander I. Vasilenko.

$$NOTE2.text:
Subject: RE: Emailing: EShell
From:    "EXI-Vasilenko, Alexander I" <Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com>
Date:    Wed, 24 Feb 2010 23:09:19 -0800
To:      "Sam Golob" <sbgolob@cbttape.org>

Sam.

I forgot to say about two new options in Mode menu    HOLD Yes
and  HOLD No .

It was one of the reasons why I began with expanding the command
list.

In our installation the "just executed" command remains in the
command string.  As we use ISRTSOA panel for job submission, so
duplicate submissions occur sometimes.  To eliminate this I
modified the panel so that the command is blanked out.  But our
Boeing friends did not like this decision.

Thus two new options appeared.

 HOLD Yes  means that executed command remains in command line.
If you use expanded panel at first time, this is default.

 HOLD No  means that the command will be blanked out from the
command line just after execution.

My preferred mode is  Execute and HOLD No.

Now I only choose commands from the stack. (Usually we use 7-9
commands to submit jobs, so for that alone, I did not need
to modify the size of the stack.

There is a good way to control stack contents.  In the
attachment you may find the VIEWPOOL command, that calls
ISPYXD1 panel.  Use Option 3 to display all the variables.

For PDF you may do an Option 7.3 for this but not for other
applications.  VIEWPOOL lets you do it for any application
(you must know the application name of course).

One more note.

I recommend performing a compress function after commands deletion.
I did not test the case when stack has gaps.

Good luck.

With best wishes,

Alexander I. Vasilenko,
WIRS Sustaining,
Programmer, Luxoft
Phone: (495) 967-80-30 (ext. 3367)

$$NOTE3.text:
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Further explanation of options for using the command stack in the
ISRTSOA panel.  You can set whatever modes you want to set.  The modes
are settable from the MODE option above the ISPF command line, when
you invoke this panel.  And the current settings of the modes will
display inside the panel itself.

Alexander will explain more below.  You have to play with the
available options and see which settings you prefer.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Sometimes you want to execute a command from the stack, and have it
disappear from the command line.  Sometimes not.  Alexander explains
below what he prefers, and why he made the modification in the first
place.  (SG)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: RE: Emailing: EShell
From:    "EXI-Vasilenko, Alexander I" <Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com>
Date:    Thu, 25 Feb 2010 23:14:10 -0800
To:      "Sam Golob" <sbgolob@cbttape.org>

All fine, Sam!

But I'd like to explain one place.

My preferred mode is  Execute and HOLD No  J
                      -------------------
Now I only choose commands from stack. (Usually we use 7-9
commands to submit a job, so I do not need to modify its).

What do I mean?

I have now all commands I need in my stack. And I can run them
without any modifications (without retrieving them in command
line) just choosing the command in stack and hitting  Enter .
Mode  Execute and Hold NO  lets me do this. It is very comfortable
because I need to repeat many times certain chains of commands for
debugging or testing the application.

Of course, the larger size of the stack lets me contain all my
commands.  It was the second reason why I began with expanding
the command list.

Sorry about the extra J, some words about this.

What was the behavior of ISRTSOA before my modification? (in our site).

I.                   Retrieve mode.

1)      I choose command in stack. Hit  Enter . The command
        appears in command line.

2)      I modify the command if necessary. Hit  Enter . The
        command runs.

3)      After execution the command remains in command line.

II.                  Execute mode.

1)      I choose command in stack. Hit  Enter . The command runs.

2)      After execution copy of the command appears in command
        line.

It was not very convenient because erroneous execution of the
command may have taken place.

By the way.

Some time ago I was in Krasnoyarsk and visited my old work.
Behavior of ISRTSOA I found was different:  THE selected command
was deleted from command line after execution.  May be it is a
version-related difference.

In any case my implementation lets you choose the most comfortable
mode for you.

One more bonus - you always may see the current mode.

With best wishes,
Alexander I. Vasilenko,
WIRS Sustaining,
Programmer, Luxoft
Phone: (495) 967-80-30 (ext. 3367)

$$NOTE4.text:
Hi, Sam!

I found a small error in ISRTSO panel.  The problem was that
Compress function did not work.  To repair this variable ZSPFCMD
in string 221 must be changed to ZCMD.

IF (&ZCMD = 'PTCCMDC')                       it is right record!!!
  *REXX(*,RSEL,ZRSEL,PTCRET01,PTCRET02,PTCRET03,PTCRET04,PTCRET05,
          PTCRET06,PTCRET07,PTCRET08,PTCRET09,PTCRET10,
          PTCRET11,PTCRET12,PTCRET13,PTCRET14,PTCRET15,
          PTCRET16,PTCRET17,PTCRET18,PTCRET19,PTCRET20,
          (DOECMP))

With best wishes,
Alexander I. Vasilenko,

WIRS Sustaining,
Programmer, Luxoft
Phone: (495) 967-80-30 (ext. 3367)

DOECMP.text:
/* REXX                                                              */
/*
   This command is used only with ISRTSOA panel.
   It realizes compress funtion.

   Author: Alexander I. Vasilenko,
           LUXOFT, Moscow.
           e-mail: ali_vas@mail.ru
                   Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com

*/
/*                         */
CALL ON ERROR
Address TSO
ZTCRET.1  = PTCRET01
ZTCRET.2  = PTCRET02
ZTCRET.3  = PTCRET03
ZTCRET.4  = PTCRET04
ZTCRET.5  = PTCRET05
ZTCRET.6  = PTCRET06
ZTCRET.7  = PTCRET07
ZTCRET.8  = PTCRET08
ZTCRET.9  = PTCRET09
ZTCRET.10 = PTCRET10
ZTCRET.11 = PTCRET11
ZTCRET.12 = PTCRET12
ZTCRET.13 = PTCRET13
ZTCRET.14 = PTCRET14
ZTCRET.15 = PTCRET15
ZTCRET.16 = PTCRET16
ZTCRET.17 = PTCRET17
ZTCRET.18 = PTCRET18
ZTCRET.19 = PTCRET19
ZTCRET.20 = PTCRET20
tempcmd.  = ''
x         = 0
trace o
do i = 1 to 20
  if ZTCRET.i ¬= '' then do  /* build list of all... */
    x = x + 1
    tempcmd.x = ZTCRET.i      /* ... not empty commands */
  end
end
PTCRET01 = TEMPCMD.1
PTCRET02 = TEMPCMD.2
PTCRET03 = TEMPCMD.3
PTCRET04 = TEMPCMD.4
PTCRET05 = TEMPCMD.5
PTCRET06 = TEMPCMD.6
PTCRET07 = TEMPCMD.7
PTCRET08 = TEMPCMD.8
PTCRET09 = TEMPCMD.9
PTCRET10 = TEMPCMD.10
PTCRET11 = TEMPCMD.11
PTCRET12 = TEMPCMD.12
PTCRET13 = TEMPCMD.13
PTCRET14 = TEMPCMD.14
PTCRET15 = TEMPCMD.15
PTCRET16 = TEMPCMD.16
PTCRET17 = TEMPCMD.17
PTCRET18 = TEMPCMD.18
PTCRET19 = TEMPCMD.19
PTCRET20 = TEMPCMD.20
/*                         */
return

ERROR:
trace o
  say 'Error in string - 'SIGL', RC - 'RC
  say sourceline(SIGL)
  say 'Error text:'
  say ERRORTEXT(RC)
exit 0

DOESHL.text:
/* REXX                                                              */
/*
   This command is used only with ISRTSOA panel.
   It realizes additional command stack.

   Author: Alexander I. Vasilenko,
           LUXOFT, Moscow.
           e-mail: ali_vas@mail.ru
                   Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com

*/
/*                         */
CALL ON ERROR
Address TSO
trace o
c_cmd = 0
ZTCRET.11 = PTCRET11
ZTCRET.12 = PTCRET12
ZTCRET.13 = PTCRET13
ZTCRET.14 = PTCRET14
ZTCRET.15 = PTCRET15
ZTCRET.16 = PTCRET16
ZTCRET.17 = PTCRET17
ZTCRET.18 = PTCRET18
ZTCRET.19 = PTCRET19
ZTCRET.20 = PTCRET20

do i = 1 to 9
  if ZCMD = value('ZTCRET0'i) then do
    c_cmd = i       /* point to cmd it stack wich match with current */
    leave
  end
end
if c_cmd = 0 then do /* no match occures in previous step */
  do i = 10 to 20
    if ZCMD = value('ZTCRET'i) then do
      c_cmd = i
      leave
    end
  end
  if c_cmd = 0 then
    c_cmd = 20
  do i = c_cmd to 11 by -1
    j = i - 1
    ZTCRET.i = Value(ZTCRET||j)
  end
  PTCRET11 = ZTCRET.11
  PTCRET12 = ZTCRET.12
  PTCRET13 = ZTCRET.13
  PTCRET14 = ZTCRET.14
  PTCRET15 = ZTCRET.15
  PTCRET16 = ZTCRET.16
  PTCRET17 = ZTCRET.17
  PTCRET18 = ZTCRET.18
  PTCRET19 = ZTCRET.19
  PTCRET20 = ZTCRET.20
end
/*                         */
return

ERROR:
trace o
  say 'Error in string - 'SIGL', RC - 'RC
  say sourceline(SIGL)
  say 'Error text:'
  say ERRORTEXT(RC)
exit 0

VIEWPOOL.text:
/* REXX                                                              */
/*

   This command calls panel ISPYXD1.

   Call format:

   VIEWPOOL (ApplID)

       ApplID - application name which variable pool you
       would like to view. This parameter is optional.
       If you do not provide it, contents of variable
       ZAPPLID will be used (usually it is ISR).

   Author: Alexander I. Vasilenko,
           LUXOFT, Moscow.
           e-mail: ali_vas@mail.ru
                   Alexander.I.Vasilenko@boeing.com
*/

if arg(1) = '?' then do
  eoh = 0
  do line = 3 until eoh
    if substr(sourceline(line + 1),1,2) = '*/' then
      eoh = 1
    say sourceline(line)
  end
  exit 0
end
/*                          */
ADDRESS ISPEXEC
if arg() then parse upper arg zapplid .
else 'VGET ZAPPLID ASIS'
'SELECT PGM(ISPYXDR) PARM('ZAPPLID') SCRNAME(VPOOL) NOCHECK'
exit RC
